intro: Trilocularia pedicellata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and occasionally invasive in certain regions.
